definition: to threaten/to blackmail

definition: to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
to work to no avail (idiom)
to spend (money or time)
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
abuse of authority
to fool/to hoodwink/to dupe
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
to bear grudges
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
